TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ImageList/ImageCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList
Public NotInheritable Class ImageList.ImageCollection Implements IList
public: ref class ImageList::ImageCollection sealed : System::Collections::IList
type ImageList.ImageCollection = class interface IList interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Encapsulates the collection of objects in an .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is used to manage the images in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> programmatically, providing methods to add and remove image objects.
## Examples The following code example shows how to select, remove, and display images, from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Images%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> class, which is an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageCollection> type.
[!code-cpp[Classic ImageList Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic ImageList Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic ImageList Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic ImageList Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic ImageList Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic ImageList Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Adds the specified object to the .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Drawing.Icon value) cil managed

Docs.param: An to add to the list.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified icon to the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.Icon> is converted to a <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap> before it is added to the list.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates constructing an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.%23ctor%2A>, adding images to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Images%2A> property, setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageSize%2A> property, and using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Draw%2A> method. To run this example, place it in a form that contains a button named `Button1`. The example assumes the existence of FeatherTexture.bmp and Gone Fishing.bmp at c:\Windows\\. Change the example accordingly if the bitmaps do not exist on your system or exist at another location.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.HelpProviderAndImageListExample#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.HelpProviderAndImageListExample/CPP/form1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.HelpProviderAndImageListExample#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.HelpProviderAndImageListExample/CS/form1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.HelpProviderAndImageListExample#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.HelpProviderAndImageListExample/VB/form1.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageCollection> to add several images to the collection. To add a single item, use one of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageCollection.Add%2A> methods.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 AddStrip(class System.Drawing.Image value) cil managed
Public Function AddStrip (value As Image) As Integer

Docs.param: A with the images to add.
Docs.summary: Adds an image strip for the specified image to the .
Docs.returns: The index of the newly added image, or -1 if the image cannot be added.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The number of images to add is inferred from the width of the given image.
A strip is a single image that is treated as multiple images arranged side-by-side.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageCollection.AddStrip%2A>. To run this example, paste the following code into a Windows Form that contains an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> named `imageList1` and a button and call the `AddStripToCollection` method in this example when handling the button's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click> event.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.MiscBugDriven#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.MiscBugDriven/CS/Form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.MiscBugDriven#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.MiscBugDriven/VB/form1.vb#1)]

-or-

remarks.format: ## Remarks The name of an image corresponds to its key. The key comparison is not case-sensitive. If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageCollection.ContainsKey%2A> method returns `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can check this property without forcing the creation of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.Handle%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 IndexOfKey(string key) cil managed
Public Function IndexOfKey (key As String) As Integer

Docs.param: The key of the image to retrieve the index for.
Docs.summary: Determines the index of the first occurrence of an image with the specified key in the collection.
Docs.returns: The zero-based index of the first occurrence of an image with the specified key in the collection, if found; otherwise, -1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.
The name of an image corresponds to its key in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageCollection>. The key comparison is not case-sensitive. If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> method returns -1.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Keys As StringCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of keys associated with the images in the .
Docs.value: A containing the names of the images in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The name of an image corresponds to its key, and an image key is not case-sensitive.
If none of the images contained in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageCollection> have keys, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList.ImageCollection.Keys%2A> returns an empty <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection>.
